data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you are facing forward, you should always take 10 step forward. When you are facing left, you should always take 9 step left. When you are facing right, you should always take 9 steps right. When you are facing down, you should always take 10 step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you take 4 steps and turn around you cannot turn around and return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you have to turn up the volume on the speakers, you will need 10 steps. If you have to stop at the road intersection, you will need to take a couple 4 steps back to the point where you left off. So, the answer is No.

For the first three steps, Face Forward. For the fourth and fifth steps, Move to the right. For the sixth and eighth steps, Move to the left. So, the answer is No.

If you begin with 3 steps you may return to the starting point with 7 steps or 2 steps. Taking 2 steps is the same thing as taking 3 steps and taking 3 steps is the same thing as taking 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 1 step backward to your starting place. If you always face forward you will always be facing forward but if you take 1 step backward you will always be facing backward. If you follow this instructions you will always take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
